fields.description:
* Go to the Planning Board and move an issue to a particular version
* On that version, select the cog, and choose either "Timesheet" or "People"

You get a message: 

{noformat}
Trial period expired
The Tempo plugin has been disabled. Please contact TM Software to buy a license.
{noformat}

The feature is provided by the functionality of the Tempo plugin, which is actually disabled by default in OnDemand.

For OnDemand - the message text is incorrect, it should instead recognise that the plugin is disabled and say that the plugin needs to be enabled

For Greenhopper - the menu items should not be shown to the user when the plugin is disabled


URL = https://mark02all.jira-dev.com/secure/Tempo.jspa?reportKey=licenseTrialExpiredReport
Browser = Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.7; rv:8.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0.1
GH Version = 5.7.5-studio
fields.summary: Tempo items available from Greenhopper even when the plugin is disabled

fields.description:
When importing a project from an instance with a previous version of Greenhopper (e.g. 5.7.4) into an instance with the latest version of Greenhopper installed (e.g. 5.8.4) a message is thrown on the screen (message screenshot attached).

Even if GH is upgraded to the latest version available and a new backup file is created, the error remains. It seems like a reference is kept on the backup file for the previous version of Greenhopper.
fields.summary: Error when importing project with data from a previous GH version

fields.description:
When on the rapid board and using the quick create issue, when the issue screen is set up to use tabs, those tabs don't work on the quick create issue (ie: clicking on them does nothing).

You nay need to click the "Configure Fields" then *all* button to see the tab come up. 

This may be more of a JIRA issue though since the plugin comes from there, though the Rapid Board has introduced this.
fields.summary: Quick create issue on Greenhopper rapid board does not support screen tabs

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

1. Pull up and RapidBoard.
2. Click on the 'Create Issue' button at the top right.
3. Click on 'Configure Fields' at the top right of the overlay.
4. Select 'All'.

You will notice that when you select 'All' the 'Create Another' checkbox disappears from next to the 'Create' button in the bottom right of the overlay. If that checkbox is missing, the error (see screenshot) will occur when the 'Create' button is clicked. Every time.

If instead of clicking on 'All' when configuring the fields, you checkmark each of the available fields manually, the 'Create Another' checkbox remains on the overlay and the error does not occur when you click on the create button.
fields.summary: Creating an issue while on Rapid Board and selecting Configure Fields > All Results in Error

fields.description: When utilizing the drag and drop feature of Rapid Boards to transition items through the workflow, the drop targets are often impossible to hit properly if there are only a few items in the current swimlane.  The drag and drop targets should utilize the full browser window without concern for the current height of the swimlane.  I will attach a screen shot showing the problem shortly.

fields.description:
The GH Assignee Board shows counts and sums for only some users (see ScreenshotGHAssignee.jpg). 

We are using a Microsoft Active Directory as User Directory. GH only shows information from users that are created in AD in lowecase. Mixcase or Uppercase users don't have the information displayed on the board.
fields.summary: Uppercase or Mixcase usernames problem: Greenhopper Assignee Board shows counts for only some users

fields.description: As an agile user, I would like to burn down story points similar to how I burn down hours - on a daily basis. The current story point burndown only calculates completed issues - I would like to track points in a similar fashion to hours on an issue.
fields.summary: As an agile user, I would like to burn down story points similar to how I burn down hours - on a daily basis

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
My team uses a process where story points are allocated to a story, and at the stand up each day story points are burned down on the stories.

We would like a chart that shows the remaining story points in the sprint for each day, regardless of the workflow of a story.

We currently use Excel to do this manually as we couldn't find a way to make this happen in GH. Its yuk and takes time.

We are using GH 5.7

Any help would be appreciated.
fields.summary: Story point burn down

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
There is only a "Step 1" when the user is anonymous and doesn't have browse permissions (permissions to view any rapid views).

The missing "Step 2" is "Open an existing view". It's a bit weird that there is only one step visible. At least the Step 2 should be present and say "Get an administrator to give you permissions to view the view, or have you remembered to log in?"

fields.description:
Agile Gadget shows incorrect Time Line.

We created Agile Gadget based on Filter HCS - Sprint 40 Engr Tasks

JQL Query: project = OPUS AND issuetype in (Bug, "Partner Task", Task, Improvement, "Sprint Task", Sub-task) AND (assignee in membersOf("OPUS Engineering") OR "Person who resolved the issue" in membersOf("OPUS Engineering") OR reporter in membersOf(QA) OR reporter in membersOf("OPUS ENGINEERING") or reporter in membersOf("PM team") or assignee = "joel.weeks@humanconcepts.com") AND fixVersion in ("HCS Q4 Sprint40 B1", "HCS Q4 Sprint40 B2", "HCS Q4 Sprint40 B3") ORDER BY status ASC, issuetype DESC, resolution DESC
Sorted by: Status ascending, then Issue Type descending, then Resolution descending 


End of HCS Q4 Sprint40 B3 is set in Agile to end 12/2.   Please see attachment HCS Q4 Sprint40 B3

Why Agile Gadget shows December31 instead of 12/2.  Please see attachment Agile_Gadget _Filter_HCS_Sprint 40 Engr Tasks
fields.summary: Time Line on Agile Gadget is incorrect

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We created our own Workflow

Todo->In Progress->In Review->In Test->Ready For Release-> Released

Code is complete by the time a Card is moved to In Review. This where we would like it to be considered DONE. At anypoint after this if something fails it moves back to In Progress. But
#1. The documentation say the "DONE" column owns the definition of Done, but even if we change "In Review" to "DONE" it doesn't consider it Done
#2. regardless of title of the column GreenHopper considers the rightmost column as "DONE", the left most column as "To Do" and any columns no matter how many in between those as "In Progress". Green hopper lets us create our own Task board columns, but this definition of "To Do", "In Progress", and "Done" based on column position means all graphs and charts are in accurate for our custom workflow.
fields.summary: wish to be able to configure which column in the Task board counts as done, not have it be based on column position

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Issues that are in a released version are given the term _Issues can not be ranked_ in the Rank column in Issue Navigator. However, when sorting the search results with Rank ascending, the results are not sorted as what it should be.

Here's a screenshot:
!issue-navigator.png!

Steps to reproduce:
# Create 2 versions in a project.
# Create 5 issues (e.g. A, B, C, D, E)
# Assign issues A, B and D to the first version.
# Assign issues C and E to the second version.
# Resolve issues in the first version.
# Release the first version.
# Go to Issue Navigator.
# Add the *Rank* column.
# Use this JQL to search:
{noformat}
project = Test ORDER BY Rank ASC
{noformat}
# Notice that the issues A, B and D are labeled with _Issues can not be ranked._
# However, the results are not sorted as desired.

The ideal way of sorting would be sorting issues with _Issues can not be ranked._ term first, then the rest of the issues with the _Rank number_ on them.
fields.summary: Issues in a Released Version are not Sorted Appropriately in Issue Navigator

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Recently updated to GreenHopper 5.8.3. The version upgraded from is 5.4.2. Also could reproduce on GreenHopper 5.7

Chrome version: 15.0.874.121 . Reproducible on Windows/Linux/Mac.

When Browser is zoomed in (Apple + Plus key), scrolling, paging up/down becomes very slow. When I reset the zoom to 100%, problem goes away. Switching to Card View or Summary view also makes the issue go away.

This does not occur on FireFox/Safari.

It seems related to http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=67558 but not 100% sure. This wasn't happening on this same Chrome version in the previous GH version I tested (5.4.2).  Could just be a Chrome bug at play here but would be ideal if there are workarounds as I don't have much faith in the Chrome bug being fixed anytime soon--it was filed last year.

To Reproduce:
1. Go to planning board with about 200 issues per page or so.
2. Change to List View
3. Customize the List View to populate it with a few two or three more fields than the default. You can add Components and Versions.
4. Zoom in to 120% on Chrome
5. Scroll up and down the list...slowness ensues on the browser side.
fields.summary: Chrome performance slow when zoomed in

fields.description:
In this following section on this documentation :
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Printing+Issues+in+Card+Form

{quote} 
# Select 'Print Cards' from the drop-down menu. *This will select all the issues associated with the highlighted box for print.* For example, if you want to print all the issues in a particular version, simply select the 'Version' mode of your Planning Board, choose the version in which you are interested, then use the drop-down menu that will appear in the yellow highlighted box for that version in the right-hand column.{quote}

The above statement is not really true. This has been verified on the following support ticket. GH will print ticket based on the user preferences number set by user instead.
* https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3458

I recommend we change to the following:
{quote}# Select 'Print Cards' from the drop-down menu. *This will print all the issues associated with the highlighted box for print according to the number of issue per page pre-set in user preferences.*
{quote}

Thanks,

Vicky

fields.description:
Our Kanban use of the Rapid Board is very different from our Scrum use - in particular, every item on our Kanban Board is a project, with it's own 'release'.  We don't want to use GH versions for that (they would get 'out of control', since we have items being done every couple days).  But we do want to have a way to get them off the board.  It'd be nice if we could "release" them to an existing version that we choose, rather than creating a new one every time.  For now, we're just ignoring the release function and manually changing the version.  But it'd be nice to have a more Kanbany release function.

Also, we almost never would want to release everything in the Done column at once.  Since the cards are selectable, it'd be nice if the release function worked only on the cards selected rather than on all cards in the column.  Our procedure is to leave cards in the done column for a couple days, then remove them.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user I'd like to be able to "release" work items to an existing release

fields.description:
If you disable the rapid board I would expect GH not to use AO. However, this is not the case as there is a Atlassian Events listener (aka RankIssueEventListener) that always listens for IssueCreated (IssueDeleted) events and ranks (unranks) the affected issue.

I would expect the RankIssueEventListener is do nothing if the RapidBoard is disabled.

NOTE: You cannot disable RankIssueEventListener from the UI (its an Atlassian Event Listener not a JIRA Event Listener).
fields.summary: Not possible to stop using AO in 5.7.4

fields.description:
There's some inconsistency with how the constraint counts and the swimlane counts (when the swim lane is collapsed) are handled when a filter is applied (also when the detail view is used).  I've seen 3 different results:
# The column constraint counts don't change if a filter is selected.  For example, I had 9 items in a column constrained to 7 - big red bar down the column.  I then chose a quick filter that filtered down to only 3.  The constraint count still showed 9, and still showed the big red bar, even though there were only 7.  See the attached ConstrainCountsWrong.jpg (sorry for the value judgement - in this case "wrong" means "doesn't equal what's shown")
# In that same scenario, if I collapse the swimlane, it shows a count of 3 when I have the filter, and 9 when I don't.  These are both correct for the # of items that show when I expand the swimlane.  (So I judge this is "correct", or at least accurate, but still inconsistent with the column constraint count.
# Now, with no filters, I select one of the items in that column and view detail - so it's now showing just the one column and the detail for the item.  The swim lane count still counts ALL items in that swimlane, even the ones that aren't in that column (ie. if you expand the column, you see 8 items, but the count is 9).  So, wrong in terms of count doesn't equal actual shown, and wrong because inconsistent.  See swimlanecountwrong.jpg attachment.

Unfortunately, I can see arguments for all of these results, so "what's expected" should be documented and then I can educate my users.  BUT, I think the inconsistency is a bigger problem for users, because the way the detail view works - it looks like a "filter result" (ie only that column) to the users (particularly the product owners), and so the inconsistency is a little harder to explain.

My personal vote: the counts should reflect what's on the board at the time taking into account any filters and also the pseudo-filtering of the detail view.  That's easiest to explain, and also provides more value than keeping the same count as non-filtered (which is available by not filtering).
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I would like the constraint and swimlane item counts to be consistent when filtered

fields.description:
We have somewhat flexible ship dates, as the content of our SW release is fixed at the beginning of a sprint.  We also cannot "release" a version until all the work is done (we aren't allowed to defer work to another revision).  Therefore, it is important for stakeholders to see the impact of "extra" work in the sprint due to overloading up front (how late did we end up relative to plan).

We'd like to have the hour-burndown show this by keeping the red guideline fixed to the planned "end date", but allow the chart to include dates to the right after the planned end date out to our actual "release date".  

In 5.7.1, the version "release date" has no impact on the charting capabilities, only the "end date" is used, and the guideline burndown is fixed to it.
fields.summary: Allow chart board to display guideline to planned end date, but work out to a later release date

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We need to have ability to use Kanban board. The main idea is to see something like on the first page of the "Kanban and Scrum - making the most of both" book.

http://www.infoq.com/minibooks/kanban-scrum-minibook.

There are exact requriements.

1. We need to limit tickets count for the not finished and finished tickets in one number. Like on the picture. Now haven't this ability and have to put two numbers in two columns. So we have to create two columns for each stage (for example "Planning" and "Planning Done", "Development" and "Development Done") and limit maximum count of tickets on each of them. This makes desicion of setting that limitations more complexity and our working process on issues less obvious.
There is two options of solving this problem
* to have one limit for two columns(like in the book)
or
* to have ability to see any indication on ticket that it is done on this stage. So we do not need to create two colulms for each stage.

Second option looks like more simple for implementation.
2. We need to see definitions of done (DoD) for each stage on the board.
3. We need to see metric "lead time" on the board or in other place.
4. We need to see indication of capacity exceeding for the stage even if we use filtration by user.

Can we expect the implementation of this features?
fields.summary: Kanban Taskboard Improvements

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Our work items may have different "weight" depending on the column they're in.  For example, we have a work item type that is very easy for development (1/10 the dev work that other items are) but is the same work for QA and Operations as other work items.  We've found the best way to do that is to be able to configure the column constraints differently for each column, based on a separate field (such as Story Points, or Work Item Weight, or whatever).  So we want to configure one column for a constraint of 3 "Work Item Weights" but the next column for a constraint of 5 items.  We can do this today in that old fashioned task board, but were disappointed to find it unavailable in the newfangled Rapid Board.  We're stuck using both, for different things (sigh).
fields.summary: Ability to set column constraints separately for each column (and by other fields, not just item count)
